channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: US avoids government shutdown after bill passes
item.description: Congress votes to pass a budget deal to avert what would be the first US federal government shutdown since 2019.

item.title: What happens if Congress doesn't fund the government?
item.description: If lawmakers can't reach a deal to avoid a shutdown, many federal workers would be furloughed, while essential functions like Social Security payments...

item.title: Senate approves bill to expand Social Security to millions of Americans
item.description: Senators approve a bill to expand Social Security benefits to millions of Americans, with President Biden expected to sign it into law.

item.title: Five killed in strike on Russia's Kursk after deadly missile attack on Kyiv
item.description: A reported attack on a Russian town comes after Ukraine said Moscow had launched a new attack on Kyiv.

item.title: Faced with turmoil, a defiant Trudeau hangs on - for now
item.description: As the longest serving G7 leader, the Canadian prime minister has weathered many storms. But this time might be different.

item.title: Warriors, water and a white horse: Photos of the week
item.description: A selection of news photographs from around the world.

item.title: 12/20: CBS Evening News
item.description: At least 2 dead, dozens injured in Germany Christmas market attack; Kids inspired by Secret Santa give out total of $10,000 to strangers

item.title: Santa and Mrs. Claus use military transports to bring Christmas to an Alaska Native village
12/20: CBS News Weekender
item.description: Lana Zak reports on a deadly car crash at a Christmas market in Germany, the race from lawmakers to prevent a government shutdown, and gives us a look...

item.title: At least 2 dead and dozens injured after a car plowed into a German Christmas market
item.description: A car plowed into a busy outdoor Christmas market in the eastern German city of Magdeburg in what authorities believe was an attack. The driver was ar...

item.title: The Fight for a Crucial City in Ukraine
item.description: Ukrainian soldiers are struggling to stabilize defensive lines near the city of Pokrovsk, in the country's east, against Russia's much larger advancin...

item.title: A year in radio: Some of the favorite stories from 2024
item.description: Some of the All Things Considered staff whose voices you don't always hear on air share their favorite stories that aired on the show in 2024.

item.title: A unique spin on the classic holiday eggnog
item.description: It's the time of year when we indulge in some favorite holiday treats and drinks like eggnog. Chef JJ Johnson, the founder of fast-casual restaurant F...

item.title: After shooting, Wisconsin school and church lean into Christmas message for comfort
item.description: For Christians around the world, Christmas is the joyful celebration of the birth of Jesus. The faith community at Abundant Life Christian School in M...

item.title: Five unanswered questions from the Pelicot trial
item.description: Although the Pelicot trial is over, some questions remain over the case that shook France.

item.title: Advocates want Biden to spare the lives of the 40 prisoners on federal death row
item.description: Anti-death penalty advocates hope President Biden will grant clemency to 40 people on federal death row. He has already commuted the sentences of near...

item.title: What to know about the winter solstice, 2024's shortest day
item.description: The 2024 winter solstice, the shortest day of the year, happens on Saturday, Dec. 21, and is marked with traditions and celebrations around the world.

item.title: Murder and terrorism charges brought against Iranian officer in 2022 killing of American in Iraq
